headline: How Investors May Respond To Exxon Mobil (XOM) Expanding Comarch Loyalty Platform Across Key European Markets
summary: In mid-January 2026, Comarch announced a new contract with ExxonMobil to roll out its CLM Enterprise loyalty platform and mobile app across key European markets, expanding their existing U.S. cooperation to modernize ExxonMobil's customer engagement systems. This technology upgrade may strengthen ExxonMobil's ability to retain fuel and convenience customers in Europe, supporting more resilient retail volumes and a smoother customer experience as competition intensifies. Against this...

headline: Coterra and Devon Explore Merger to Create Major U.S. Shale Player
summary: CTRA and Devon are in early talks over a merger that could reshape U.S. shale amid weak oil prices and rising consolidation pressure.

headline: How ExxonMobil Keeps Rewarding Shareholders Across Various Oil Cycles
summary: XOM keeps rewarding investors with rising dividends and buybacks, backed by low-cost assets and low debt, even in volatile oil markets.

headline: ExxonMobil Taps Shearwater Geoservices for a Large Seismic Survey
summary: XOM hires Shearwater Geoservices to run a large 3D seismic survey offshore Trinidad and Tobago to support deepwater oil and gas exploration.

raw.summary: XOM hires Shearwater Geoservices to run a large 3D seismic survey offshore Trinidad and Tobago to support deepwater oil and gas exploration.

headline: Scotiabank and Wolfe Research Cut Exxon Mobil (XOM) Price Targets
summary: Exxon Mobil Corporation (NYSE:XOM) is one of the 12 Best American Energy Stocks to Buy Now. On January 16, Scotiabank reduced its price target on Exxon Mobil Corporation (NYSE:XOM) from $155 to $128 and maintained its Outperform rating on the stock. The research firm is updating its price targets for US integrated oil companies, refining […]

headline: Assessing Exxon Mobil (XOM) Valuation After Venezuela Access And European Loyalty Expansion
summary: Event driven interest in Exxon Mobil Recent headlines around Exxon Mobil (XOM) center on two fronts: its role in Venezuela and Guyana, and a fresh contract to modernize loyalty programs across key European fuel markets. See our latest analysis for Exxon Mobil. Exxon Mobil’s share price has gained 11.31% over the past 30 days and 15.24% over 90 days to US$129.89, while its 1 year total shareholder return of 19.89% and 5 year total shareholder return of around 2.4x suggest momentum has been...

headline: CEOs, World Leaders Prep for Awkward Encounters at Davos
